**Match Details:**

* Teams: MI New York and Texas Super Kings
* Date: Sunday, July 14, 2024
* Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
* TV Channel: Willow TV
* Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas (not explicitly mentioned but implied as one of the two venues)

**Teams' Standing:**

* Texas Super Kings: 1-1 with 2 matches abandoned, 2nd place
* MI New York: 1-1 with 1 match abandoned

**League Overview:**

* Major League Cricket is a six-team T20 cricket league
* Started play in 2023
* All games are played at one of two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina
* The entire league season takes place in July

* There are three matches scheduled for Saturday, July 20, featuring the San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas.
* All three matches have the same start time: 8:30 PM ET.
* The TV channels broadcasting the matches are NBC Sports Networks and Willow TV.
* The matches can also be live-streamed on Fubo with the International Sports Plus package, which offers a 7-day free trial.

**Match 18: San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas**

* The match will be played on July 20th at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
* **San Francisco Unicorns**: Currently 2nd in the points table with 3 wins and 1 loss. Top run scorer is Matthew Short (151 runs) and top wicket taker is Liam Plunkett (5 scalps). They won their previous match against MI New York by 3 runs.
* **Seattle Orcas**: Currently at the bottom of the points table with 1 win and 4 losses. Top run scorer is Ryan Rickelton (225 runs) and top wicket taker is Cameron Gannon (9 scalps). They lost their previous match against LA Knight Riders by 4 wickets.

**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Scorecard:** San Francisco Unicorns scored 156/4 in 14.2 overs, while Seattle Orcas scored 152/7 in 20 overs.

**Key Performances:** Finn Allen scored a rapid 77 off 30 balls, and Hassan Khan delivered an outstanding bowling performance to lead the San Francisco Unicorns to victory.

**Tournament Standings:** The San Francisco Unicorns remain in second place on the points table with nine points from six matches, while the Seattle Orcas have been officially eliminated from the tournament.

**Playoff Implications:** The San Francisco Unicorns have already qualified for the playoffs.

* The 18th fixture of the MLC 2024 season will be played between San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas on July 21 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

* The San Francisco Unicorns are favorites to win the upcoming contest due to their stronger team composition.

In the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament, a remarkable incident occurred during a match between Seattle Orcas and San Francisco Unicorns. Seattle Orcas' pacer Lungi Ngidi took an impressive one-handed catch but unfortunately fell past the ropes, resulting in a six being conceded. The shot was hit by Sherfane Rutherford off Harmeet Singh's bowling. Ultimately, San Francisco Unicorns won the match by six wickets.

**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of MLC 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Match Highlights:**

* San Francisco Unicorns remain in second place on the points table with 9 points from 6 matches, while Seattle Orcas have been eliminated from the tournament.
* Finn Allen scored a quick-fire half-century (77 off 30 balls) to help San Francisco Unicorns chase down the target of 153 runs.
* Hassan Khan took 3 wickets for 5 runs to restrict Seattle Orcas to 152/7.
* Quinton de Kock scored 62 off 33 balls to anchor the innings for Seattle Orcas.

**Other Key Points:**

* San Francisco Unicorns have already qualified for the playoffs.
* Seattle Orcas lost both openers in the first over, but Quinton de Kock's half-century helped them post a decent total.
* Finn Allen's explosive batting and Hassan Khan's impressive spell were the key factors in San Francisco Unicorns' victory.

* The 18th game of Major League Cricket 2024 will take place on July 21 at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Seattle Orcas.
* Both teams are looking to win the game to improve their standings in the points table.
* The Unicorns have a mixed record so far, with 2 wins in 4 matches, while the Orcas have had a tough season, with only 1 win in 5 matches.

The 19th game of Major League Cricket 2024 is scheduled to take place on July 22 between Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and MI New York at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Texas. Both teams are struggling in the tournament, with LAKR in 4th place with 2 wins, 3 losses, and 1 draw, and MI New York in 5th place with only 1 win. The teams are looking for a crucial win to improve their rankings in the points table.
* Seven South African squad members are currently competing in the Major League Cricket tournament in the US.

**Current Standings and Playoff Picture**: Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns have qualified for the playoffs with 5 and 3 wins, respectively. Texas Super Kings are third with 6 points, and Los Angeles Knight Riders need to win their last game to qualify.

**Tournament Success**: The second season of MLC has been a huge success, with the decision to broadcast the league in India on Sony Sports Network and JioCinema proving to be a major hit.

**Player Performances**: Top players like Marcus Stoinis, Kieron Pollard, and Andre Russell are performing well in the competition and receiving deserving appreciation.

**Final Match Tickets and Popularity**: Due to high demand, 500 more tickets have been made available for the final match. The tournament has also led to an increase in cricket popularity in the US following the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.

**Sponsors and Partners**: The tournament has attracted various sponsors and partners, including Cognizant (Title Partner), Stake, Willow by Cricbuzz, Lexus, Royal, Remitly, NTT Data, and an Official Umpire Apparel Supplier.

* The Seattle Orcas (SOR) lost to the San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) in a recent match, with SFU chasing down the target of 152 runs with six wickets and over five overs to spare.
* The match was played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 21, and SFU opener Finn Allen scored 77 runs off 30 deliveries to lead his team to victory.
* SOR's Shehan Jayasuriya took a spectacular one-handed catch to dismiss SFU's Sanjay Krishnamurthi, but struggled to score runs himself, getting dismissed for 31 off 33 balls.
* The loss marked SOR's fifth defeat in six matches, leaving them at the bottom of the six-team table and eliminating them from the tournament.
* SOR captain Heinrich Klaasen expressed disappointment with his team's performance, citing poor batting and a lack of firepower as the reasons for their struggles.
* SOR will play their final match of the tournament against the Texas Super Kings (TSK) on July 24.

The 2024 Major League Cricket tournament is in its final stages, and several bowlers have delivered impressive performances. The top 5 highest wicket-takers in the tournament so far are:

1. Saurabh Netravalkar (USA) - 12 wickets from 4 matches with an economy rate of 7.17
2. Cameron Gannon (Seattle Orcas) - 10 wickets from 6 matches with an economy rate of 9.15
3. Glenn Maxwell (Washington Freedom) - 9 wickets from 6 matches with an economy rate of 6.66
4. Lockie Ferguson (Washington Freedom) - 9 wickets from 6 matches with an economy rate of 7.27
5. Harmeet Singh (Seattle Orcas) - 8 wickets from 6 matches with an economy rate of 7.70

These bowlers have been consistent and effective in taking wickets and controlling the run rate in the tournament.

**Current Standings:** Washington Freedom is leading the tournament with a 5-0 record, followed by San Francisco Unicorns in second place with a 3-2 record.

Marcus Stoinis and Aaron Hardie are playing for Texas Super Kings.

**Notable Performances:** Steven Smith and Travis Head have been in good form, with both making half-centuries in their recent match. Faf du Plessis is the leading run-scorer with 264 runs, and Ryan Rickelton is the other century-maker in the tournament so far.

**Match Details:**

* Match 17: Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom
* Date: July 20 (Saturday)
* Time: 6:00 AM IST
* Venue: Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium, Dallas

**Match Details**: The 17th match of the Major League Cricket tournament will be played between Texas Super Kings (TSK) and Washington Freedom (WF) on July 20th.

**Current Standing**: TSK is currently third in the points table, having played 5 matches, while WF is at the top of the points table and has already qualified for the Knockout stage.

**Team Strengths**: WF has a strong batting lineup featuring Travis Head, Steve Smith, and Glenn Maxwell, backed by a potent bowling attack featuring Lockie Ferguson and Marco Jansen. TSK also has a strong batting lineup with Devon Conway, Faf du Plessis, and Naveen-ul-Haq.

**Pitch Report**: The match will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, which is a batting-friendly pitch where the batting first team has an advantage. The average first-inning score is 160.

**Head-to-Head Record**: The article does not mention the head-to-head record between TSK and WF.

**Dream11 Prediction**: The article provides fantasy picks for the Dream11 team, including captain and vice-captain choices for both Small League and Grand League teams.

**Injury Scare**: A serious injury occurred during the San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas match when bowler Carmi Le Roux was hit on the head by a ball while bowling to Ryan Rickelton. Although badly injured, Le Roux was able to walk off the field on his own accord.

**MI New York on the Verge of Elimination**: Defending champions MI New York are struggling at the bottom of the table after a 3-run loss to San Francisco Unicorns. The Unicorns scored 148/7, with Corey Anderson top-scoring with 59 not out, while MI New York's chase was hindered by the loss of Ruben Clinton early on and ultimately fell short of the target. The result puts MI New York's playoff hopes in jeopardy.

**Key Performances**: Corey Anderson (59 not out) and Hassan Khan (44) had a crucial 87-run partnership for the Unicorns, while Matthew Short (3/27) was the best bowler for the Unicorns. Dewald Brevis scored 56 runs for MI New York.

**Post-Match Reaction**: MI New York skipper Kieron Pollard attributed the loss to a 15-ball middle period where they failed to score boundaries, and also cited luck not being on their side throughout the tournament.
